intro: Collaea rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leafed collaea, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pinkish flowers. The plant has rounded, leathery leaves that are often covered in a fine, powdery coating. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and maritime climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and threatened species.
